name: AnnotationsForAll
short_description:
Source code annotations expressing the requirements or intent of software are useful for (1) human understanding of the software and (2) automated static checking of the software. This project is a repository for annotated source code that cannot be maintained with the original source itself. 

The project is NSF-funded under Grant No. ACI-1314674 in NSF’s Transition to Practice perspective in the Secure and Trustworthy Computing program. Any opinions, findings, and conclusions or recommendations expressed in this material are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the National Science Foundation.

Licensing: Licensing conditions are provided with and specific to individual contributions. All contributions must have OSI-approved licenses to be consistent with NSF requirements.
summary: Repository for source code annotations that assist static analysis
